pl.kustra

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.kustra.Parser

  • class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Main parsing class, which does most of program's work. Parent class ParsingContext sets all strategies used for parsing (@STRING substitution strategy and single record parsing strategy).

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        java.util.List<Entry> parse(java.lang.String filePath)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Main parsing method that parse file to array of objects, it uses other methods as helpers in parsing. It also validate if all required attributes are provided.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to file
        Returns:
        All parsed objects
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when file wasn't found

      • parseEntry

        private Entry parseEntry(java.util.Scanner text,
                         java.lang.String type)
        Parse individual Entry.
        Parameters:
        text - Scanner with unparsed bibtex
        type - Type of Entry to create
        Returns:
        Parsed entry with all passed attributes + key and crossref values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when passed attribute has wrong pattern (e.g. comma in the value)/when attribute is invalid (Entry that do not contain passed field)

      • parseStringVariable

        void parseStringVariable(java.util.Scanner text)
        Parse individual String Variable, saving it in order to use it later.
        Parameters:
        text - Scanner with unparsed bibtex
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when passed attribute has wrong pattern (e.g. comma in the value)

      • parseInside

        java.lang.String parseInside(java.util.Scanner text)
        Parse individual Entry to String value of what entry has inside of its brackets.
        Parameters:
        text - Scanner with unparsed bibtex
        Returns:
        String with text of individual Entry inside of brackets
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when input is invalid - opening brackets do not match with closing brackets

      • parseAttribute

        java.lang.String parseAttribute(java.lang.String text)
        Parse value of single attribute which could contain String Variables.
        Parameters:
        text - Scanner with unparsed bibtex
        Returns:
        value of individual attribute
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when value of attribute do not exist (Strings Variables)

      • checkRequired

        void checkRequired(Entry object)
        Checks if all fields required for given entry type are filled.
        Parameters:
        object - Entry object to checked
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when required argument don't have value
